text: Didac Salas Planas (born 19 May 1993) is a Spanish athlete specialising in the pole vault. He won the gold medal at the 2010 Summer Youth Olympics. His personal bests in the event are 5.60 metres outdoors (Palafrugell 2014) and 5.60 metres indoors (Prague 2015). ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2009 |World Youth Championships |Brixen, Italy |10th |4.65 m |- |rowspan=2|2010 |World Junior Championships |Moncton, Canada |11th (q) |5.05 m1 |- |Youth Olympic Games |Singapore |bgcolor=gold|1st |5.05 m |- |2011 |European Junior Championships |Tallinn, Estonia |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |5.40 m |- |rowspan=2|2012 |World Junior Championships |Barcelona, Spain |4th |5.50 m |- |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |14th (q) |5.30 m |- |2013 |European U23 Championships |Tampere, Finland |9th (q) |5.35 m1 |- |rowspan=2|2014 |Mediterranean U23 Championship |Aubagne, France |bgcolor=silver|2nd |5.57 m |- |European Championships |Zürich, Switzerland | – |NM |- |rowspan=2|2015 |European Indoor Championships |Prague, Czech Republic |10th (q) |5.60 m |- |European U23 Championships |Tallinn, Estonia |5th |5.40 m |- |2016 |European Championships |Amsterdam, Netherlands |27th (q) |5.15 m |- |rowspan=2|2018 |European Championships |Berlin, Germany |29th (q) |5.36 m |- |Ibero-American Championships |Trujillo, Peru |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |5.10 m |} 1No mark in the final ==References== Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Spanish male pole vaulters Category:Catalan athletes Category:People from Vallès Occidental Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2010 Summer Youth Olympics Category:Youth Olympic gold medalists for Spain
title: Didac Salas
